frame.name: Part_piece
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame is concerned with transparent nouns denoting a <fen>Piece</fen> of a <fen>Substance</fen>. Also present is <fen>Piece_prop</fen> which is a property of the <fen>Piece</fen>, e.g. relating to its size.
<ex>Kim ate a <fex name="Piece_prop">tiny</fex> <t><fex name="Piece">morsel</fex></t> <fex name="Substance">of cake </fex></ex>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Piece
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Piece</fen> made of a substance.<ex>Sergey had a few <t><fex name="Piece">morsels</fex></t> <fex name="Substance">of bread</fex> for breakfast.</ex> The specific whole entity from which the <fen>Piece</fen> comes is not specified. Thus, the following sentence is not in frame: <ment>A piece of the TV fell of the floor.</ment></def-root>

FE.name: Piece_prop
FE.definition: <def-root>A property relating to the <fen>Piece</fen>.<ex>Sue had a <fex name="Piece_prop">big</fex> <t><fex name="Piece">piece</fex></t> <fex name="Substance">of cake</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Substance
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Substance</fen> is what the <fen>Piece</fen> is made of and may describe the type of larger whole from which it came.<ex>Sue ate a <fex name="Piece_prop">big</fex> <t><fex name="Piece">piece</fex></t> <fex name="Substance">of cake</fex>.</ex></def-root>
